reviews.review_msg: Clearly interested in what she teaches, but you may find it dull and dry if you're not interested in English literature. Otherwise, her lectures are very clear and I have learned a lot from her class. Few complaints here. Only one would be her slight lack of organization, but it isn't a significant issue.
Very passionate and knowledgeable--would recommend.

One of my favourite profs at SFU, the material was dry at times but he made lectures interesting.0 and fun He obviously cared about the material and his excitement was infectious, overall I would love to take another course with him.

He is so passionate and knowledgeable about the subject that you can probably feel it during his lectures. After taking his course, I am confident to say I have known more about the topics we discussed and am very interested to pursue further studies in the same field. Also I would say he is a bit towards the lenient side in terms of grading.

Lovely woman, great teacher. I found her to be extremely witty, very engaging and was really approachable before, between and after classes. Lots of fun, makes lecture a blast. Can't wait to take another class with Kirsten and I wish SFU would give her tenure.

She is an excellent orator, everything she has to say is important and useful. Do NOT skip lectures or you will find yourself sorely lacking. She provides great historical background and insight that you cannot get without attending. It isn't easy, but she is more than willing to offer help. Work hard and you will do well.
Great lecturer that has good presence. Very approachable and professional.
Amazing prof!! Charming, compassionate and inspiring! Would definitely recommend. She takes material that can be dull and changes it into something really interesting every lecture.
Challenging but fun! Very nice and helpful too.

Would have enjoyed the material so much more if her syllabus hadn't been so stressful. She really packs on the coursework, as if the crazy amount of readings weren't enough. I felt like I was taking a 400-level course! She also goes over things very briefly, then expects you to know everything. Nice lady, but I really wish I hadn't taken her class.

Dr. Werth is an amazing professor! She really knows her stuff and goes into great depth in lecture and is very clear on what should be known for exams. I can't comment on her marking because I had a TA mark my work. I would highly recommend taking her classes, she is a pleasure to listen to!

She is the sweetest prof I have ever met. She genuinely cares about her students and reaches out to students who may be struggling. She's extremely helpful and understanding. She believes in all her students and wants them to succeed. There's also no wrong answer, only a "new way" to look at the question. Would take a class with her again happily.

The sweetest prof I have ever met. She genuinely cares about students as human beings and makes an effort to reach out to those who may need help. You can never give a wrong answer, just a "new way" to look at it. I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to take a class with her again. She can also answer any question like she's superwoman.

Jim Fleming: no-nonsense, no-faker, old school admirable honesty of scholarship! Ideologically & philosophically, I could not be more apart from this guy, but you take a course with Prof. Fleming and you get your faith in decency of high academics restored!

JD is a caring and passionate prof. Course concepts are often very philosophical and may be difficult to follow, so I would suggest writing down everything he says verbatimit'll help you in the long run. His course definitely makes you work hard and think deeply about course concepts which I found really interesting. Would take again!

One of the best professors I've ever had, his enthusiasm for the subject is so infectious and his lectures are golden. Professor Fleming is super funny, and nice to everyone. I wouldn't say this class was easy, but I only went to half the lectures and I still did ok, mostly because of his great review sheets. Most of the texts are public domain.

Every lecture was like a well-written, award-winning essay. He's frighteningly intelligent.  But final exam is just his lecture material. Basically regurgitate what he has said throughout the semester. Can't talk about his marking, because I had a TA mark my essays, but I once saw him  strike an entire page of an essay with his red pen :S
who doesn't want to learn from someone who has something to offer? fleming definitely knows his material. a bit intimidating, but easy to listen to as his fondness of himself is quite amusing.

Hussey is just fantastic. Extremely bright, funny and completely engaging. He talks fast and will expect you to do the readings (obviously). Doesn't use overheads so a laptop is useful to follow his fast pace. Well worth the effort, he knows his stuff and you are guaranteed to enjoy his class. He's also suuuuper adorable, which doesn't hurt!

Extraordinarily nice. One of the few TAs who genuinely cares about both the material and his students. Universities really need to start hiring based on quality teaching, and Steve definitely fits the bill. Fun, engaging, able to build a fantastic rapport with students, and very knowledgeable about the subject matter. Love him!
very intriguing prof. hard to fall asleep in his class imo. i hear it sucks if he's your TA though. Lots of time for your papers.
Very talented at lecturing. Engaging, concise, expressive, and relevant. Highly recommended.
